sentences.english: That's why it could be therapeutic.
sentences.chinese: 這就是它能夠療傷的原因。

sentences.english: “Try not to use the kids as therapists,” says Breuner.
sentences.chinese: “不要用孩子來療傷”布魯納說。

sentences.english: Andy and Rooster MacBride went by way of the infirmary.
sentences.chinese: 安迪和盧斯特還先被送到監獄的醫務室療傷。

sentences.english: Time may be a great healer, but it's a lousy beautician.
sentences.chinese: 時間也許是很好的療傷者，卻是個很差的美容師。

sentences.english: There is power and healing in gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 這是感恩的力量和療傷作用。

sentences.english: The Samurai Blue have three months to lick their wounds.
sentences.chinese: “藍武士”有三個月的療傷時間。

sentences.english: My grandfather and uncle were forced to return to their village until his recovery.
sentences.chinese: 祖父和叔父被迫返回他們的村莊療傷。

sentences.english: Shi ZhengYuXiang narration know feelings have been hurt, so she wants to accompany his healing.
sentences.chinese: 仕筠知道鄭雨翔感情受到的傷害，所以她要陪他療傷。

sentences.english: It's not that self-medicating is necessarily bad — but you should give yourself parameters.
sentences.chinese: 自我療傷並不糟糕，但是你必須給自己一個參照標準。

definition: to talk sb round/to straighten sth out/to enlighten
good medicine/panacea/fig. a good solution/a good remedy (e.g. to a social problem)
to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
to lose one's love/to break up (in a romantic relationship)/to feel jilted
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
